Game Developers Con=
ference Europe 2003 registration open

 

Save up to 30% off GDC Europe con=
ference passes at www.gdc-europe.com
by registering now:
http://info.gamane=
twork.com/cgi-bin4/DM/y/hLzk0FFH2d0EIw0Bc3d0AB
<http://info.gamanetwork.com=
/cgi-bin4/DM/y/hLzk0FFH2d0EIw0Bc3d0AB> 

 	 
The game industry is comfortab=
ly in the middle of a console lifecycle, PC
graphics technologies continue =
to advance at a rapid rate, and new
opportunities including mobile gaming c=
ontinue to offer developers an array
of options.

Yet significant challenge=
s face developers today. 

*	How do small development houses survive in a h=
igh stakes
environment? 

*	How do large shops streamline their production =
methods and pipelines
efficiently and optimally? 


*	Which technologies an=
d processes should be integrated to yield the
best results? 

Moving forwar=
d, the time to prepare for the next generation systems is now,
before busin=
ess plans are written, and well before development kits arrive.
How will th=
e next generation affect game development and what unforeseen
issues will a=
rise? 

GDC Europe addresses the serious issues facing game developers toda=
y and
tomorrow. 

Four days of thought provoking keynotes, lectures, tutori=
als, panels and
roundtables provide relevant and essential information and =
inspiration
across the technical, artistic, and business aspects of game de=
velopment. 

Join Europe's leading developers to explore the future of deve=
lopment and
make better games.

 	 
  <http://www.gdc-europe.com/gifs/Updat=
es/images%20for%20scott/dots2.gif>

io Proceedings for $399!

vidually by track -

 	 GDC Europe Mobile
26 August 2003 	
 	 As millions of mobil=
e users open new revenue streams for both
mobile operators and game develop=
ers, now is the time to capitalize on this
opportunity. 

At GDC Europe Mob=
ile, leaders from the mobile communications industry meet
with Europe's bes=
t game developers. 

Network operators, content aggregators, technology and=
 infrastructure
providers and leading game developers will explore next gen=
eration
technology, platform standardization, and viable business models.
